descriptions: No attempt to count unit squares or completely inaccurate.

Counts unit squares with limited accuracy; frequent errors in counting.
Counts unit squares with reasonable accuracy; some errors may be present.
Counts unit squares accurately with only minor errors or omissions.
Counts unit squares accurately and efficiently, demonstrating a clear understanding of area measurement.
No units are used or the wrong units are used.
Units are used inconsistently and often incorrectly.
Units are sometimes used correctly, but there are inconsistencies.
Units are generally used correctly, with occasional errors.
Units are used correctly in most cases, showing good understanding.
Units are always used correctly and appropriately (e.g., square cm, square in), demonstrating a strong understanding of area measurement.
Does not demonstrate an understanding of area as a measure of space.
Demonstrates very limited understanding of area; struggles to relate counting to area.
Demonstrates some understanding of area, but struggles to apply it correctly.
Demonstrates a reasonable understanding of area; can relate counting to area in simple cases.
Demonstrates a good understanding of area and its relationship to counting unit squares.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of area as a measure of space, clearly linking counting unit squares to the concept of area.
